snippet: The law was designed to prevent illegal immigrants from getting professional licenses. It has led to weeks of waiting time.
abstract: Georgia law that requires people seeking professional licenses to prove they are in the United States legally, which was designed to clamp down on illegal immigrants, has led to weeks of waiting time for all applicants and a licensing backlog.
lead_paragraph: The law was designed to prevent illegal immigrants from getting professional licenses. It has led to weeks of waiting time.

headline.seo: Licensing Law Creates Backlog in Georgia
headline.main: Georgia Law Requiring Proof of Legal Residency Creates Licensing Backlog
headline.print_headline: Georgia Law Requiring Proof of Legal Residency Creates Licensing Backlog
